column4: Hey guys, I'm installing the java package so I can play minecraft and other things, but on the license agreement, when I press space, it doesn't work. Could someone enlighten me to what I'm meant to do?
which java package are you installing?
At the moment, sun-java6-bin I think.
Are you installing using Software Center or using command line?
Yeah, it's on the license agreement for that and I can't get past it.
Erm
It's the terminal command line, yeah.
!enter rquiros
ok, then did you get to the blue screen that asks if you accept the license?
It's just on the license, lots of words etc about it, and an Ok button.
May I add I spammed the heck out of the Ok button.
Press tab key to highlight the OK button in red.  Then press enter.
Oh thanks!!!
:D
Thanks for the help :)
yw
I knew it was something stupid like that I've got to do lol.
There we go, all installed -)
nothing is stupid!  Glad it worked for you.  But, there is one more thing you need to do...
are you singh Ubuntu 10.10 ?
Ubuntu 10.10 comes with Open JDK.  You will need to tell it to use the Sun version/
on the terminal type: sudo update-alternatives --config java
then pick the number for /usr/lib/jvm/java-6-sun/jre/bin/java
